intro: Taonabo andina, commonly known as the Andean taonabo, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Taonabo andina plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small insects.
